headline: What's News: Business & Finance

headline: China Manufacturing Growth Slows
summary: The official Purchasing Managers Index for December fell to 51, still on the expansion side but slightly below expectations, indicating the challenges facing Chinese exporters.

headline: Rebels Attack South Sudanese City
summary: South Sudan moved a step closer to civil war after antigovernment forces attacked the city of Bor.

headline: Vietnam Coffee Growers Hold Out
summary: Coffee growers in Vietnam, the world's top producer of robusta beans, are holding back sales as harvest nears an end, hoping for better prices.

headline: Failing at the Gym? This App Helps
summary: A new app called FitStar uses real information about your body to eliminate intimidating workouts that lead to broken resolutions, Geoffrey Fowler writes.

headline: Data Likely Destroyed in Train Crash
summary: Two black box-type event recorders from the train derailment in North Dakota were likely destroyed, but other key data collection devices are likely to be recovered.

headline: Farhad Manjoo to Tech Crybabies: Grow Up
summary: Stop clamoring for technology's next breakthrough. The smartphone and the tablet are the next big things, and we act like spoiled children when we claim they somehow aren't enough, says columnist Farhad Manjoo.

headline: Campbell Soup Recalls Some Prego Sauce
summary: The potential spoilage, which was discovered during routine testing, didn't affect any other Campbell products and the food products maker said no consumer illnesses have been reported to date.

headline: Chicago Homicides Down in 2013
summary: The number of killings in Chicago dropped to 413 from Jan. 1 through Dec. 30, the lowest since the 1960s.

headline: Health-Plan Enrollment Surpasses 2.1 Million
summary: Nationwide enrollment in private health plans under the Affordable Care Act has topped 2.1 million, the Obama administration said.

headline: Want a Job? Learn to Code
summary: Codecademy's Zach Sims says he created his online instructional startup in the belief that computer-programming skills can be a ticket to upward mobility.

headline: A Fork That Tells You to Slow Down
summary: The $100 HAPIfork vibrates in your mouth when you eat too fast and wirelessly reports your good (or bad) habits to your smartphone.

headline: Big Year for Dollar
summary: Dollar index rises 4.8%, biggest annual gain since 2008

headline: Bombardier Wins Large Jet Order
summary: Bombardier said it signed a multibillion-dollar deal to sell 38 business aircraft to an unidentified customer.

headline: Law Enforcement Braces for Rose Parade Crowds
summary: Parade-goers flock to Pasadena, Calif. for the Tournament of Roses as law-enforcement officials braced for the crowds by employing extra security precautions.

headline: Oil Futures Retreat, But End Up for 2013
summary: Oil futures finished the year at an eight-session low as traders took profits from a recent price gain, but prices rose 7.2% in 2013.

headline: U.S. Oil Inventories Seen Falling Again
summary: U.S. crude-oil stocks are expected to drop for a fifth straight week in data due Friday from the Energy Department, according to a survey of analysts by The Wall Street Journal.

headline: Coffee Futures Tumble 23% in 2013
summary: Futures for the most widely grown variety of coffee swooned in 2013 as swelling supplies from Brazil and Colombia weighed on prices.

headline: Year's Worst-Performing Commodity: Corn
summary: Corn prices plunged this year as production in the U.S., the world's biggest grower and exporter of the grain, broke records.

headline: U.S. Judge Upholds New York Gun Curbs
summary: A federal judge in Buffalo upheld most of New York's 2013 gun-control law as constitutional, handing a victory to gun-control advocates and to Gov. Andrew Cuomo, who signed the bill into law last January.

headline: U.S. Stocks Close Year With Broad Gains
summary: U.S. stocks rose on the final trading day of 2013, capping the Dow industrials' biggest annual rally in 18 years.

headline: Natural Gas Ends Banner 2013
summary: Natural gas futures ended the year up 26%, the largest percentage gain for any commodity in 2013.

headline: Fisker Creditors Seek Sale to Wanxiang
summary: Creditors of hybrid-car company Fisker, unhappy with Hybrid Tech Holdings LLC's bid, are pursuing a rival bid from Wanxiang.

headline: Vitamin E Can Slow Alzheimer's Decline
summary: A high daily dose of vitamin E slowed functional decline in patients diagnosed with mild to moderate Alzheimer's disease by about six months, according to a new study.

headline: Revlon to End China Operations
summary: Revlon unveiled plans to exit its operations in China and eliminate 1,100 positions, moves that come as the beauty-products company has posted declining sales in its Asia Pacific market.

headline: U.S. Mint's Gold Coin Sales Rise, Silver Sets Record
summary: Gold coin buyers bought more from the U.S. Mint in 2013, while silver coin sales set a record

headline: Fashion Secret: How to Keep the Smoothest Silhouette
summary: Teri Agins answers a reader's question about no-show bras

headline: 2014 Fashion: From Chic to Eek
summary: There's good news about what people will be wearing in the new year--more elegant clothes with a big comfort factor. The bad news? Pricier clothes and oh those boxing shorts.

headline: Foodies' New Calling: Waiting Tables
summary: Top-tier head waiters can earn $80,000 to $150,000 a year including tips, versus $35,000 to $45,000 for a line cook with longer hours.

headline: SAC Capital Outperforms Peers in 2013
summary: Steven A. Cohen is exiting the hedge-fund stage with a 2013 performance that is ahead of the pack.

headline: Photos of the Day: Jan. 3
summary: In today's pictures, Buddhist monks and nuns pray in India, a bomb dating back to World War II explodes in Germany, a strike turns deadly in Cambodia, and more.

headline: Apple Denies Working With NSA
summary: Apple said it never worked with the National Security Agency to create a backdoor way for the organization to spy on iPhone users.

headline: Bill de Blasio's Team
summary: Ahead of his inauguration as the 109th mayor of New York City on Jan. 1, 2014, mayor-elect Bill de Blasio announced his choices for some of the key positions in his administration.

headline: Treasury Prices Fall, Close Out Losing Year
summary: Treasury bonds closed the year with their biggest annual loss in five years. The benchmark 10-year yield ended the year above 3%.

headline: Gold Falls 28% in 2013
summary: Call it the year gold melted down. Gold prices fell Tuesday, locking in the largest annual decline since 1981 and ending a 12-year bull run.

headline: Chip Bets Look Frothy After Avago
summary: Companies that spend billions to acquire other businesses aren't typically rewarded by investors until the payoff from the deal becomes clear. That is why Avago accomplished such a notable feat.

headline: Stryker to Buy Maker of Bar-Coded Sponges
summary: Medical-products maker Stryker said it will pay nearly $120 million to acquire Patient Safety Technologies and its so-called Safety-Sponge System.

headline: Taiwan Confirms Second Human Bird-Flu Case
summary: Taiwan confirmed its second human case of the H7N9 bird flu, a sign that the deadly virus is spreading further beyond mainland China

headline: Voices: Cecily Welch, On Working with a Surviving Spouse
summary: "If advisers begin over-communicating and putting pressure on a grieving client about investment decisions, more often than not that client will leave."

headline: Companies Sell Record $1.111 Trillion of Bonds in 2013
summary: Rising bond yields and steady economic growth were two reasons companies were able to attract investors despite the worst return in five years.

headline: The Year of the Actor
summary: Joe Morgenstern looks at the top individual performances in the year in film. Hint: there were many.

headline: Argentina Extends Foreign Currency Amnesty
summary: Argentina has extended a controversial tax amnesty for a second time, giving residents with hidden foreign currency another three months to bring the money out into the open.

headline: Chicago PMI Below Expectations, Sees Growth
summary: A survey of purchasing managers in the manufacturing-heavy Midwest came in below expectations, but still pointed to growth. The December Chicago PMI fell to 59.1 from 63.

headline: H-P Affirms Higher-End Layoffs Figure
summary: Hewlett-Packard confirmed it has increased by 5,000 the number of layoffs it plans to implement under the restructuring plan it adopted in May 2012, bringing the expected number of job cuts to 34,000.

headline: U.S. Moves Closer to Closing Guantanamo Bay
summary: The Pentagon transferred the last three Uighur Chinese nationals to Slovakia, leaving 155 detainees at the military prison.

headline: Afghanistan Considers Freeing Detainees, Alarming U.S.
summary: Afghanistan is considering freeing dozens of detainees deemed by American officials to be a "direct threat" to U.S. and allied troops.

headline: Nuclear Waste Sits on Ocean Floor
summary: More than four decades after the U.S. halted a controversial ocean dumping program, the country still has few answers on how to handle atomic waste it pitched in the sea.

headline: Mortgage Program Pans Out
summary: The government's Home Affordable Refinance Program stands out among the alphabet soup of initiatives rolled out to stem a wave of foreclosures: It is one that is finally living up to its ambitions.

headline: Consumer Confidence Jumps
summary: U.S. consumers feel much more upbeat about the economy in December after two months of pessimism triggered by the October government shutdown, according to a report.

headline: China's Housing Market Perks Up
summary: China's housing market showed a modest pickup in December from November, as routine year-end difficulties in securing mortgages and a slower pace of launches capped price growth.

headline: Israel Records Slower Economic Growth in 2013
summary: Israel's economy expanded less than was forecast in 2013, due to fewer exports. The country's gross domestic product rose just 3.3% for the year.

headline: Twitter Bulls Surge Into Options
summary: The total number of bullish Twitter options outnumbered that of bearish bets for the first time on Monday. The move comes despite a 17.5% drop in the company's shares over the past two sessions.

headline: Europe Stocks Cap Bumper Growth Year
summary: European stocks cemented their biggest annual gain since 2009, edging up in the final session of the year.

headline: Historic Mediterranean in Denver
summary: A home with ties to the mining days of Colorado and a history of philanthropic owners has been restored to its original grandeur.

headline: Russia Blasts Put Spotlight on Dagestan
summary: Conflict in the republic of Dagestan has again exploded onto the global stage as investigators believe Islamic militants are behind twin suicide blasts that have raised fears ahead of the Olympics.

headline: Jurist Prudence? Judges Speak Out
summary: Judges typically confine their opinions to their rulings. But 2013 was a year of exceptions as one judge started a blog and another took a self-reflective view of his work in a book.

headline: Advisers Set Goals for New Year
summary: Many financial advisers are setting new goals and making resolutions for the New Year. Here we share a handful of them, which may inspire others to do the same.

headline: U.S. Home Prices Continued to Rise in October
summary: Housing prices remained on an upward trend in October, but growth may not be as strong in 2014, according to S&P/Case-Shiller.

headline: The Best of Bollywood in 2013
summary: In pictures, a selection of the most talked about Bollywood films in 2013.

headline: Debenhams Warns on Profit
summary: U.K. retailer Debenhams issued a profit warning after its crucial Christmas selling period was hurt by a "highly promotional" retail landscape, prompting a slide in its share price.

headline: China's Drug Watchdog Halts Imports Of Pfizer Medication
summary: Chinese regulators halted imports of Pfizer's antifungal medication Diflucan, citing a late application for the drug.

headline: London IPOs Highest Since 2007
summary: New firms raised Â£15.7 billion ($25.91 billion) in a bumper year of initial public offerings on the London Stock Exchange.

headline: China Markets Underperform Region
summary: Asian shares were mixed on last day of the year, with Shanghai ranking as the region's worst-performing market of 2013.

headline: Cambodia Plans Legal Action on Strike
summary: Cambodian authorities say they will take legal action against garment-worker unions that refuse to end a weeklong strike.

headline: Nasdaq to Take Stake in Borsa Istanbul
summary: Nasdaq will take a 5% equity stake in Borsa Istanbul as part of a deal that also includes technology-sharing and advisory services. Nasdaq will have the option to increase its stake in the Turkish entity by 2% and will receive a series of cash payments.

headline: Bangladesh Issues Arrest Warrant for Factory Owner
summary: A court in Bangladesh issued arrest warrants for the owners of Tazreen Fashions factory where a fire killed more than 100 workers.

headline: Schumacher Improves Slightly
summary: The condition of the seven-time Formula One champion has slightly improved after he underwent further brain surgery to address life-threatening head injuries.

headline: China's IPO Market Reopens
summary: After a freeze of more than a year, China has reopened the market for initial public offerings, allowing five companies to pitch IPOs to investors as soon as Thursday.

headline: Congo Clashes Death Toll Reaches 100
summary: The death toll from clashes between the Congolese army and supporters of former presidential candidate Joseph Mukungubila has risen to 100.

headline: Private Equity's Struggle to Spend It
summary: Private equity opened the floodgates on five years' worth of pent-up demand for portfolio company floats in 2013. The bigger challenge next year could be finding new deals in an increasingly crowded market.

headline: Philippines Aims for Safer Celebration
summary: The Philippines has announced a nationwide campaign to discourage gun owners, police and military from firing their guns in the New Year celebration.

headline: French Priest Freed in Cameroon
summary: Georges Vandenbeusch, who was taken hostage in November, has been freed, the president's office said.

headline: Singapore Airlines Renews Low-Cost Push
summary: The operator of one of the world's most storied premium airlines is pushing forward with a strategy of competing across a range of segments despite a slow start for its first effort.

headline: Indonesian Volcano Spews Lava, Ash
summary: A volcano on Indonesia's Sumatra island is spewing lava and ash, while its lava dome has partially collapsed, offering experts some sign the volcano may be nearing the end of a period of heightened activity.

headline: The 10-Point: Gerard Baker on Obama's Next Move, Market Winners of 2013, Teaching Rationality, and More
summary: A personal, guided tour to the best scoops and stories every day in The Wall Street Journal, from Editor in Chief Gerard Baker.

headline: Impasse on Northern Ireland Talks
summary: Politicians failed to reach agreement following all-night talks on proposals meant to bolster hard-won peace accords.

headline: India in Pictures: 2013
summary: A look at some of the most memorable photos of 2013.

headline: Antarctic Rescue on Hold for Weather
summary: Rescuers plan to use a helicopter to airlift passengers aboard the stranded Russian ship Akademik Shokalskiy when the weather improves.

headline: What's News
summary: Here are the top business stories from today's Wall Street Journal Asia.

headline: What's News
summary: Here are the top business stories from today's Wall Street Journal Europe.

headline: Tech Renegade Pushes Untraceable Currency
summary: Cody Wilson rattled lawmakers with a plastic gun he created from a 3-D printer. Now, the 25-year-old is about to launch software aimed at covering the tracks of financial transactions made with bitcoin.

headline: Behind Assad's Comeback, a Mismatch in Commitments
summary: A Hezbollah surge to bolster Assad represented a turning point in the Syria conflict, giving the Syrian leader enough strength to survive, though not enough to prevail.

headline: The Real Lord of 'Downton Abbey'
summary: Julian Fellowes talks about his creation as season four of 'Downton Abbey' is set to air in the U.S.

headline: Second Russia Blast Stokes Olympic Fears
summary: A suicide bomber struck in Volgograd, killing at least 16 people aboard a bus in the city's second terrorist attack in 24 hours and stoking security fears ahead of the Olympics.
